Package: org.ysb33r.groovy.dsl.vfs.impl.ant

[Groovy] Class SelectorUtils

    • org.ysb33r.groovy.dsl.vfs.impl.ant.SelectorUtils

    • This is a utility class used by selectors and DirectoryScanner. The functionality more properly belongs just to selectors, but unfortunately DirectoryScanner exposed these as protected methods. Thus we have to support any subclasses of DirectoryScanner that may access these methods.

      This is a Singleton.

      • Properties Summary

          ' situation, so skip one patIdxStart++ continue } // Find the pattern between padIdxStart & padIdxTmp in str between // strIdxStart & strIdxEnd int patLength = (patIdxTmp - patIdxStart - 1) int strLength = (strIdxEnd - strIdxStart + 1) int foundIdx = -1 strLoop: for (int i = 0; i <= strLength - patLength; i++) { for (int j = 0; j < patLength; j++) { String subPat = tokenizedPattern[patIdxStart + j + 1] String subStr = strDirs[strIdxStart + i + j] if (!match(subPat, subStr, isCaseSensitive)) { continue strLoop } } foundIdx = strIdxStart + i break } if (foundIdx == -1) { return false } patIdxStart = patIdxTmp strIdxStart = foundIdx + patLength } !((patIdxStart..patIdxEnd).any { tokenizedPattern[it] != DEEP_TREE_MATCH } ) } /** Tests whether or not a string matches against a pattern. The pattern may contain two special characters:
          '*' means zero or more characters
          '?' means one and only one character

          Returns:
          true if the string matches against the pattern, or false otherwise.
          Parameters:
          pattern - The pattern to match against. Must not be null.
          str - The string which must be matched against the pattern. Must not be null.
          caseSensitive - Whether or not matching should be performed case sensitively.

        • static boolean matchPath(java.lang.String[] tokenizedPattern, java.lang.String[] strDirs, boolean isCaseSensitive)

          Core implementation of matchPath. It is isolated so that it can be called from TokenizedPattern.
